1.text: Make an x-shaped slit in the lid of a cylindrical plastic food-storage tub.

2.text: Cut a paper towel roll into sections that will fit in your plastic tub.

3.text: Place one of the paper towel sections inside the plastic container.

4.text: Pour 1 cup (240 mL) of an EPA-approved disinfecting solution over the paper towels.

5.text: Allow the paper towels to soak in the solution overnight.

6.text: Pull the cardboard tube out of the center of the roll.

7.text: Thread the inner end of the paper towel roll through the slit in the lid.

8.text: Use enough wipes so that the surface remains wet for 3-5 minutes.

9.text: Discard any wipes immediately after using them.

10.text: Use soap and water or commercial hand sanitizer if you can.

11.text: Combine 2⁄3 cup (160 mL) of 99% rubbing alcohol and 1⁄3 cup (79 mL) aloe vera gel.

12.text: Pour the mixture into a clean plastic container.

13.text: Squeeze the mixture onto a paper towel or tissue.

14.text: Wipe your hands thoroughly and discard the wipe.
